conclusion: Analyze the flow path of the liquid from openings A, B, C, and D to containers E or F.
Liquid flows from the top through openings labeled A, B, C, and D.
Each opening is connected to a baffle that directs the flow downward.
Liquid flows through opening A and follows the yellow baffle, directing it to the left side.
Liquid flows through opening B and follows the green baffle, directing it to the center-left.
Liquid flows through opening C and follows the cyan baffle, directing it to the center-right.
Liquid flows through opening D and follows the light blue baffle, directing it to the right side.
Leftmost and center-left flows (from A and B) are directed towards container E.
Center-right and rightmost flows (from C and D) are directed towards container F.
Liquid from openings A and B will flow into container E.
Liquid from openings C and D will flow into container F.
Container E will receive liquid from A and B.
Container F will receive liquid from C and D.
